post_text:
Changes to Curbside Meals:
After today things are changing!!

Starting Monday, September 14th 2020, the Child Nutrition department will start serving multiple meals twice a week. Monday you will receive two of each breakfast and lunch, Wednesday you will receive three of each breakfast and lunch. These will be the only days to pick up meals curbside at Faller Elementary, Inyokern Elementary, Pierce Elementary, and James Monroe Middle School between 11am and 1pm

Students do not have to attend the school of which they choose to pick up a meal. Students do not need to be present at pickup.

Grab & Go Menu

Friday 9/11- Taco Pocket!

Monday 9/14 - Pizza & Orange Chicken

Wednesday 9/16 – Double dogs, Taco Salad, & Cheeseburger

To see our menu online go to ssusdcafe.com

Thank you for your support

post_text:
Here are some great FAQs from the Kern County Superintendent of Schools: On July 17, 2020, Governor Newsom and the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) released guidance related to the re-opening of public and private schools for the 2020-21 school year. The new requirement only allows schools to re-open for on campus in-person instruction when the county the school is in has been off of the state Monitoring List for 14 consecutive days. The guidance also addresses the criteria and process for re-closing schools once they have opened for on campus in-person instruction.
Furthermore, the guidance addresses the wearing of face coverings, social distancing, increased hygiene practices and cleaning,
Below are some FAQs regarding the new guidance:

https://kern.org/2020/07/18/state-rolls-out-new-guidance-for-reopening-schools/
shared_text:

post_text:
Sierra Sands is deeply saddened to inform our community that one of our trusted and beloved board members, Amy Castillo-Covert, unexpectedly passed away on May 10. Elected in 2000, Amy has continuously served the interests of students and our district ever since. She was especially passionate about our district's beneficial association with the National Association of Federally Impacted Schools (NAFIS). Above everything, she measured every decision by its benefit to students.

We will greatly miss her devoted governance and total commitment to our district. Her loving family is planning a Celebration of Life to take place this summer. More information will follow. Please keep her children and her family in your thoughts during this very painful time.

IMPORTANT! VAN DELIVERY OF GRAB AND GO MEALS, ROUTE #2 IS EXPANDING!

Route #2 is adding a stop to better serve our community. The van will arrive a little earlier to all the stops and we have added N Brown Rd. and Coyote Trail to the route. Please review the new times and the additional stop.

11:10 - 11:20 Ward/ Pinto (15 minutes earlier)
11:25 - 11:40 Ward/ Strecker
11:45 - 12:00 Saguaro/ Chaparral
12:05 - 12:20 Athel/ N Brown Rd.
12:35 - 12:50 N Brown/ Coyote Trail (new stop)

As always we appreciate your support.
Please keep a safe distance from people outside your family.

post_text:
IMPORTANT! MEAL DELIVERY ON ROUTE 2 HAS AN UPDATED ROUTE.

Sierra Sands will deliver, in a district Van, to the following stops:

Route # 2

Ward/Pinto 11:25 – 11:40

Ward/Strecker 11:45 - 12:00

Saguaro/Chaparral 12:05 -12:20

Athel/N. Brown 12:35 – 12:50

IMPORTANT: Each stop lasts 15 minutes. Times may be adjusted, if so an additional Parent Square will be sent out of any changes to the times. You will receive one lunch for that day AND one breakfast for the following morning for each person. No meals will be given for adults and no meals will be given for children not at the bus stop. These are the rules of the program that pays for the meals. Route 1 remains the same.

Route # 1

Graff/Wayne 11:25 – 11:40

Reeves/Sierra View 11:50 – 12:05

724 Adkins 12:20 – 12:35

Upjohn Park 12:50 – 1:05

James Monroe Reminder: We are serving in the staff parking lot.

post_text:
IMPORTANT! PLEASE READ CURBSIDE CHANGES EFFECTIVE MONDAY, APRIL 20, 2020

Based on our responses to our recent poll on Parent Square we are adding

TAKE AND BAKE ENTREE'S to our grab and go lunches!!

Mondays and Fridays beginning the week of April 20th you will need to

Check your child’s bag for a TAKE AND BAKE ITEM. Cooking instructions will be included.

Cold sandwiches will still be offered for those not wanting to participate in heating the entree.

All sites are continuing to serve meals and the van routes will have ‘Take and Bake’ too.

Thank you again for the support you have given to the Food Service Staff.

Stay Safe

post_text:
AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM THE SUPERINTENDENT:

Dear Parent/Guardian:

As we head into Spring Break, April 6-10, I want to thank you for all of your support and resilience over the past three weeks. As we transition into district-wide Distance Learning starting April 13, we realize no one could have anticipated the way our daily routines would change, and for as long as this change would impact us. However, we are working through these challenges together. Together we are stronger!

As a reminder, please know that we will continue grab and go food service during the spring break, Monday-Thursday, April 6-9 (however, we will not be providing food services on Fri., April 10 or Mon., April 13).

Sincerely,
Dave Ostash,
Superintendent

post_text:
Chromebook Information

We received several questions from those of you who picked up a Chromebook today. Please understand that these devices remain district-owned devices and are intended for students to use for school work only. Only the student will be able to login to the device using their school email address, and all activity on the Chromebook will be monitored just as if it were at the school.

We are very grateful to be able to support families so that students can continue to learn! Thank you. Team Sierra Sands.
text:

Only the student will be able to login to the device using their school email address, and all activity on the Chromebook will be monitored just as if it were at the school.

We are very grateful to be able to support families so that students can continue to learn! Thank you. Team Sierra Sands.

post_text: Thank you to our community for an inspiring day. Sierra Sands staff were overwhelmed by the incredible turnout of parents/guardians who want to be sure their children continue to learn. For clarification, we have enough Chromebooks to hand out to only those families who do not already have at least one device in their home for student use. Thank you.

post_text: Parent Pro Tip! If you'd like to download your TK-8 student's Instructional Packet, here's how. Go to www.ssusd.org. Hover over "Our Schools" in the dark blue line. A drop down of all district schools will appear. Click on your school! Your school's website will open up. About halfway down the school homepage you will see 3 stacked brightly colored books with the words "March 23 Instructional Packets". Click on it! This will then give you the option to pick your desired grade and view/download the instructional packet. You got this! 👍

post_text:
Sierra Sands will be providing ‘Curbside Grab and Go’ Meals, at no cost, beginning March 17th at these sites:

Inyokern Elementary
Faller Elementary
Pierce Elementary
James Monroe Middle

Monday through Friday
Breakfast pick up between 8:00am - 9:30am
Lunch pick up between 11:00am – 1:00pm

During the extended closure all children ages 1-18 are eligible to receive a meal. They must be present in the car.

Any new information will be posted via Parent Square.

shared_text:
Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake
February 5 at 5:08 PM ·

Supersonic testing will be conducted within the NAWS China Lake area TOMORROW, Feb. 6 from approximately 9:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. This testing will likely produce sonic booms that could be heard on the Installation and local communities such as Trona, Ridgecrest and Inyokern.

post_text:
Just a reminder to turn your Impact Aid Survey card in to your school as soon as possible! Thanks!
***************************
Dear SSUSD Families,

On October 2, your student received a 3-page stapled packet that contains our annual Impact Aid Survey card (on blue card-stock paper). Please review the cover letters from Capt. Dale and me, and kindly return the blue Impact Aid Survey card back to your school as soon as possible. We require 100% of the cards to be returned so that we are in full compliance with this very important Federal program. Thank you in advance, Dave Ostash

post_text: If you have been displaced temporarily due to the earthquakes or are between residences please let the school office know. It is important to update your address with the school. You could be eligible for busing to your school of origin. Assistance can also be provided with school clothes and supplies. Contact your school office as soon as possible!

post_text: From Dave Ostash, Superintendent: In order to most efficiently and thoroughly complete preliminary safety assessments of all schools, the district is canceling the remaining portion of summer school and extended school year (ESY). Students and staff should look for an email from Principal McClelland explaining their options for receiving an early grade, or finishing their coursework in our credit recovery program in the fall.

post_text:
Important Message from Superintendent Ernie Bell:

As we hope you know, student safety is among the District’s highest priorities. We take seriously any concerns related to any form of conduct that is or may be harmful to any student. The District recently hired a substitute employee who served for 48 days in the Sierra Sands school district. Immediately upon learning of concerns related to that substitute employee, the District placed him on administrative leave. The substitute is no longer employed with the District. Although personnel matters are confidential, we can assure you that the District acted quickly and appropriately to address all concerns. Please do not hesitate to contact Dr. Dave Ostash, Assistant Superintendent of Human Resources at 760-499-1620 with any further questions or concerns.

Please do not hesitate to contact Dr. Dave Ostash, Assistant Superintendent of Human Resources at 760-499-1620 with any further questions or concerns.

post_text:
ALL SSUSD SCHOOLS REMAIN OPEN ON WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 5:
As you may know, President Trump has ordered the closing of Executive Departments and Agencies of the federal government on December 5, 2018 as a mark of respect for George H. W. Bush. This affects ONLY the federal government and does NOT affect school districts. Sierra Sands schools will remain open and on a normal Late Start Wednesday schedule on Wednesday, December 5, 2018.

shared_text:
Sherman E. Burroughs High School
August 29, 2018 at 11:32 AM ·

Reminder- Back to School Night is tonight. The orchestra will play in the Parker Performing Arts Center from 5:30-6:00. Mr. Auld will give a short presentation from 6:00-6:30. Classroom visits begin at 6:35.

Two important announcements:

- there will be staff in the library from 5:30-6:30 to help parents either sign up for or log on to ParentSquare and/or PAMS (Aeries Gradebook). If you need help with either, please use this time to get set up.
- if you student has an "excused" period, please do not jump ahead and go to their next class. Please wait and stay on schedule. Our teachers teach several different classes. It is possible that the presentation you would hear if you jump ahead is for a class you child doesn't take.

We hope to see ALL parents on campus this evening!!!

post_text: This notice is a follow up message to inform you that Murray is back on normal status and the lock down has been lifted. Law enforcement is completing its investigation of the Facebook threat that was made by an individual who lives out of town. We are confident that there is currently no threat to safety on campus; however, there will be police presence on campus for extra precaution.

We are confident that there is currently no threat to safety on campus; however, there will be police presence on campus for extra precaution.

post_text: This notice is to inform you that administration placed Murray Middle School on lock down as a protective measure at approximately 11:15 am.The school was made aware of a Facebook threat made by someone out of town toward Murray Middle School. Ridgecrest Police Department is investigating the matter and is onsite at Murray right now, along with district administration.There is no immediate threat or danger.We are taking precautionary measures out of an abundance of caution.

post_text:
Good Afternoon,

I want to send out a reminding invitation to our parents and community members regarding the Educational Forums that will be conducted this week. We want to make a difference in the education of all of our children and one of our priorities is to strengthen our partnership with you in meeting our students' needs. As we make plans to strengthen our educational programs for next year and years to come we need your input. Please join us as we have several dates/times to choose from:

Tuesday, April 10 at Pierce Library
6:30 pm

Wednesday, April 11 at James Monroe Staff Lounge
7:30 am and 6:30 pm

Thursday, April 12 at Burroughs Library
8:30 am and 6:30 pm

Wednesday, April 18 at Inyokern Library
6:00 pm

Ernie Bell
Superintendent

post_text:
Subject: Richmond Gate Closure

All,

The NAWS Richmond Rd. Gate, commonly referred to as the back gate, will close on Monday, April 9 for construction. The project will last 6 months and is scheduled to reopen on Sunday, Sept. 30.

The Vieweg Gate will serve as an entry/exit option for the Installation during the Richmond Gate closure. The Vieweg gate is located off of Chelsea St. and Rowe St., behind the SpringHill Suites. (see attached map)

The Vieweg Gate will be open as follows beginning April 9 (Monday through Friday, flex and non-flex):
* 5 a.m. to 9 a.m. - Inbound Traffic Only
* 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. - Inbound Traffic Only
* 2 p.m. to 6 p.m. - Outbound Traffic Only
CLOSED ON WEEKENDS AND HOLIDAYS
*Normal badging and access procedures apply (personal must possess proper credentials for entry).

The Main gate and Sandquist gates will remain open with no changes to posted hours of operation during this time.

NAWS PAO

post_text: We are closely monitoring an ongoing police investigation currently taking place on the north side of town. As of this moment, none of our schools are on lock down. RPD has created a perimeter set up around the area where the suspect is currently located. Given the distance from our campuses and the fact that law enforcement has the suspect contained, they are not advising a lock down at this time. We will continue to monitor this situation and take appropriate actions as necessary. Thank you.

post_text: Good morning: This morning it was reported that a small SUV had entered BHS with what was believed to be a rifle in the back seat of the car. Ridgecrest Police Department responded immediately, an off campus stop was made on south China Lake Blvd. and officers found a small BB gun. A lock down was not initiated as the vehicle immediately left campus. We take every precautionary measure to ensure the safety of our students and staff.

The lock-down was lifted at 11:20 a.m. All students and staff are safe and have resumed normal activity.

post_text: Back to School Nights are upon us! Please note: The Mesquite Back to School Night has changed to September 6.

post_text:
Burroughs High School Traffic Map.
Please review the image attached. This is our new traffic pattern. The primary student drop off is clearly marked at the NW corner of the access road (next to the four blue/white portable classrooms). Please pull all the way forward when dropping your student. Please also be mindful of traffic as you merge back on the access road. There is now a "turn around" that can be used as an alternative to driving all all the way through campus. There is a "secondary" drop off zone on the North side of the campus (where the previous drop off zone existed).

There will be temporary signs posted to help you navigate for the first several days.

Please be for cautious during the first few weeks as the community acclimates to this new traffic pattern.
